page.title: 02TRANSPORT IN SWAFFHAM
page.content: Swaffham's situation provides good opportunities for road transport links.The main 'A' roads link the town with King's Lynn, Norwich and the south, via the A11 and M11. Formerly the town was also connected to the main rail links but the line was closed in the 1960's. Public Transport is now provided by bus and coach services which are maintained by both local and national companies. In 1981 the town was bypassed, diverting the A47 to the north of the town in a part single, part dual-carriageway route, leaving the town free from the summer jams of holiday traffic.
